titleStmt.title: The state of His Majesties revenue in Ireland as the same was given in to the Right Honourable the Lords Commissioners of His Majesties treasury in England, by Francis Lord Angier vice-treasurer of Ireland. And also, the humble proposals of the Right Honourable Richard Lord Viscount Ranelagh upon the said state. Together with His Majesties contract thereupon, concerning His whole revenue in Ireland, by letters patents bearing date the 4th of August, 1672.
titleStmt.author: Aungier, Francis, Earl of Longford, d. 1700.
Ranelagh, Richard Jones, Earl of, 1638?-1712. aut

notesStmt.note: Bound with C3119 "Letters patents granted by His Majesty, 1672" following, which item is also found at reel 2474:22a, bound with A3163D following.
Reproductions of originals in: University of Cambridge. Library (reel 1901:9) and Folger Shakespeare Library (reel 2474:22).
